channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Cycle Diversion from Streatham Hill to Brixton Hill, 22nd August
item.description:
There is a cyclist diversion from Streatham Hill to Brixton Hill due to the road works. When cycling north, the diversion comes out onto Brixton Hill meaning I (and other cyclists) have to turn right across 4 lanes of traffic to get back onto the route. This simply isn't safe. Can the diversion be redirected to avoid having to cross this road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Tulse Hill, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stones and loose bricks from a driveway causing obstruction on pavement, 22nd August
item.description:
The driveway of 78 The Drive has loose stones which are causing a major trip hazard on the pavement. I was walking on the pavement and stepped on a large stone that rolled under my feet.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bicycles using car parking, 22nd August
item.description:
There is a designated parking bay that has been newly installed on Park Street, roughly the size of one car’s worth of parking space. This new space has become a nuisance for the local residents, as members of the public who use this space to keep the Lime bikes are highly inconsiderate and completely disregard the limits of the parking space. The Lime bikes overflow into the road and often into the parking that is designated for cars, taking up 2 additional spaces. This is causing a disruption and irritation to the local residents, as we all pay to park our cars in these bays, but are unable to since this new bay for the bikes has been allocated.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28-30, Park Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped car seat on the pavement, 22nd August
item.description:
74 oakdene road dumped the car seat on the pavement on Tuesday thinking it'll get picked up by the recycling staff. However when it didn't, they collected their bins and left the car seat in the road for others to deal with. It can also cause injury as it is in the middle of the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakdene Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet
